items.title: MESSAGE:
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

MESSAGE:

Seeding Sovereignty

As mutual aid workers we know that often times addiction is the result of centuries of colonial trauma. Some coping is cheaper and easier to access, why is that...? And we know that the medical industrial complex never considered colonization as a health determinant. Until Indigenous peoples‚Äô trauma can be acknowledged and central in care work, communities will continue to suffer from addiction. But also... honoring agency and autonomy means that it doesn‚Äôt matter the conditions, everyone deserves a home, food, water, and whatever it takes to keep them alive and comfortable.

Art from @deardarlingdesignstudio

Image ID:
Over a light pink background, text in a groovy retro font reads, ‚ÄúPeople don‚Äôt need to be sober to deserve food, shelter and kindness.‚Äù

See More

items.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Casa de PazNATIVE FRENCH SPEAKER SEEKING LIVE IN NANNY/ELDER CARE POSITION DENVER A lovely mother and 7 year old...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280Casa de Paz

NATIVE FRENCH SPEAKER SEEKING LIVE IN NANNY/ELDER CARE POSITION DENVER

A lovely mother and 7 year old daughter from Burkina Faso seeking live in position caring... for your child or children or elderly relative. Bilingual. Native French speakers. Legally in US seeking asylum.

- Has been caregiver for developmentally delayed adult for 9 months. Family is moving out of state.
- CPR/First Aid certification
- Experience with children
- Light housekeeping and meal preparation
- Does not have car
- Excellent references
- Daughter enrolled in DPS schools
- Availability date is flexible.

Please contact Melanie Turner 720.308.9414 for more info!

See More

items.title: #Reparations Y‚Äôall probably remember our sister in need of...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#Reparations Y‚Äôall probably remember our sister in need of secure housing not too long ago. With our help and the help of community she was able to find a place! She started working soon after to cover her monthly expenses despite her active and debilitating condition. Just one month later she was fired after missing too much work for medical treatment AND denied disability income at the same time. She plans to appeal the denial and take legal action against her employer for ...being in violation of the ADA.

None of that will pay her bills right now though. Please, please share and give what you can. Enough people giving even just a few dollars really goes long way. And comment seen to help spread the word!

‚ÄºÔ∏èIf you have any leads on remote work opportunities or pro bono Disability Lawyers please send them to blacklivesmatter5280@gmail.com ‚ÄºÔ∏è
#BlackLivesMatter #BlackAndDisabled #CallToAction #MutualAid #CommunitySupport
(Image Description: flyer with pastel pink, blue, and yellow font on a black background reads: [venmo symbol] @Kim-and-Kush-00
Kim is fighting a brain tumor but was recently denied disability income
She can appeal but she needs our help staying housed and healthy right now
Please give what you can and share widely
#WeKeepUsSafe
There is a picture of Kim looking hopeful in the bottom left corner, and animated white embellishments arranged around the text)

Hey All, a friend is raising bail for her friend. The woman in jail is a pregnant Black woman who has $1.000 bail to go home. They are $200 short, if you can sp...are a bit to get a woman home, please do. This is the cash app, the woman‚Äôs partner.
It blows to not post on a Friday, you get stuck sitting in jail until Monday. Please help if you can.

items.title: #CallToAction From Allies to Abolitionists Denver is a...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#CallToAction

From Allies to Abolitionists Denver is a grassroots movement demanding the abolition of systemic injustice across our city and state. Below is one account of such systemic injustice for which our community demands justice and accountability.
People experiencing homelessness in the city of Denver are being violently attacked and having property confiscated and damaged by your authority. There are not enough sanitation stations and portable restroom facilities fo...r people who are experiencing homelessness in our city. During this pandemic, and the recent spike of cases, we must act now in order to save lives. These are temporary solutions that help mitigate the risk of the spread of Covid-19 and reduce the risk of death among the unhoused.
Therefore, as concerned citizens against systemic violence and criminalization of poverty, we demand that the City of Denver:
1) Immediately direct the CDPHE to terminate all evictions (sweeps) of encampments and cease enforcing the camping ban, and commit to repealing the ordinances that comprise it
2) Make existing public restroom facilities open overnight, and provide additional portable restrooms and sanitation facilities (hand washing stations) available for Denver‚Äôs unhoused people
3) Designate safe outdoor space areas for encampments for people experiencing homelessness
According to the Center for Disease control, homeless sweeps contribute to the spread of Covid-19, and prolong the need for lockdown:
https://khn.org/‚Ä¶/sweeps-of-homeless-camps-run-counter-to-‚Ä¶/
Furthermore, mental health professionals advise that sweeps of encampments exacerbate the traumas and injuries associated with those living outside:
https://denverite.com/‚Ä¶/denver-sweeps-of-unhoused-people-o‚Ä¶/
We appreciate your earnest effort and attention in this matter.
- From Allies to Abolitionists

See MoreMessage to the Mayor Campaign

items.title: ‚ÄúMost of that money ‚Äî 90 percent, or roughly $20 million ‚Äî...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúMost of that money ‚Äî 90 percent, or roughly $20 million ‚Äî will be available for individual and family renters who earn up to 80 percent of the area median income and pay for things like rent and utility costs, according to a release from the city. That means a single-person household earning up to $54,950 can qualify, while a family of four making $78,500 could qualify as well.‚Äù

We had a meeting with the Director of Housing Stability to see how they can support our Displacem...ent Defense program with these funds. We‚Äôre hopeful. As of Today our program has kept 39 Colorado families in their homes and we plan to continue providing this vital service indefinitely. So many thanks to all who have donated to keep this program alive, and many thanks to our Displacement Defense Team Marz Chandler, Keezy Allen, Kipenda Richerson and Ari Lipscomb!

https://denverite.com/‚Ä¶/denver-got-nearly-22-million-in-fe‚Ä¶/

See MoreThe money will be administered by the city's Department of Housing Stability with help from local nonprofit organizations.

denverite.com

Denver got nearly $22 million in federal money for emergency rental assistance. Here's how you can start applying for some of it.

The money will be administered by the city's Department of Housing Stability with help from local nonprofit organizations.The money will be administered by the city's Department of Housing Stability with help from local nonprofit organizations.

items.title: Thank you for more than seven decades of powerful Black women on...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Thank you for more than seven decades of powerful Black women on our screens.

Rest easy.

The Root

A legendary icon, who has impacted all of our lives, has passed away. Today, we salute Cicely Tyson, the woman who opened doors for so many and will continue to inspire generations to come. #BlackExcellence

items.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism.
